channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Our readers' tales of kindness will surprise you, warm your heart and make you smile
item.description: We invited you to share acts of kindness. The topics include new shoes, a basket of berries that aren't very tasty and an unexpected twist for someone...

item.title: At long last, the mystery of lightning on Mars is solved
item.description: A chance discovery by a NASA rover on Mars shows that the red planet has a form of lightning, which researchers had suspected for decades but never se...

item.title: 13 people killed in fire engulfing Hong Kong high-rise residential buildings, fire services say
item.description: Thirteen people were killed in a fire that spread across seven high-rise apartment buildings in a Hong Kong housing complex. About 700 people have bee...

item.title: Greetings from Amman, Jordan, where history lent a colossal hand
item.description: Far-Flung Postcards is a weekly series in which NPR's international team shares moments from their lives and work around the world.

item.title: Trump backs Witkoff after leaked call with Russian aide. And, Thanksgiving air travel
item.description: Leaked call transcripts between special envoy Steve Witkoff and a Putin advisor could derail Trump's progress on peace in Ukraine. And, air travel is ...

item.title: Where peace stands in Ukraine after frantic diplomacy
item.description: The Trump administration seems serious about reaching a deal despite all the apparent chaos around its efforts.

item.title: At least 13 dead as fire engulfs Hong Kong tower blocks
item.description: Firefighters are struggling to put out the flames and say they are unsure when the blaze will be fully contained.

item.title: Twenty-four Nigerian schoolgirls released over a week after abduction
item.description: Nigerian officials dispute reports that some 250 children remain missing after another mass school kidnap.

item.title: Campbell Soup executive made offensive customer remarks, lawsuit claims
item.description: The complaint alleges that a Campbell executive made offensive remarks about company workers and mocked customers.

item.title: Guinea-Bissau soldiers say they have taken power after reports of president's arrest
item.description: Umaro Sissoco Embaló's detention comes three days after a controversial presidential vote.

item.title: New prosecutor won’t pursue charges against Trump and others in Georgia election interference case
Will a HELOC or home equity loan be better in 2026? Lending experts weigh in
item.description: Both products provide financing with traditionally low rates, but there are unique benefits and downsides to both.

item.title: Georgia prosecutor moves to drop case against Trump and allies over 2020 election
item.description: President Trump and more than a dozen of his allies were charged with offenses in Georgia relating to the 2020 presidential election.

item.title: Here's how to handle awkward or aggressive Thanksgiving dinner conversations
item.description: Americans gathering for Thanksgiving may face some tough topics of conversation at the dinner table. Dr. Gail Saltz, an associate professor of psychia...

item.title: Video of Democrats warning military about unlawful orders at center of FBI probe, sources say

item.title: Nicolas Sarkozy illegal campaign financing conviction upheld
item.description: The former French president will have to serve a six-month term with an electronic bracelet, plus another six months suspended.

item.title: Death of Florida teenager on Carnival cruise ship ruled a homicide
